utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: I'm going to go with ribeye and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who has a ribeye --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- well marbleized. Not a lot. Just salt and pepper. And you know, flip it once or twice and there you go. Beautiful.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you a medium, medium well guy? How do you do it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Medium rare, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm not an animal like you that like sit well done.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love it well. I love it well done. I really do. Dagen, when you go to a barbecue, what are you looking forward to?

utterances.speaker: DAGEN MCDOWELL, FOX NEWS BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Corn on the cob down on the grill. Just right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I love that too.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And even summer butter beans. Although you can't take them if you're down south, demand them. They're delicious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, demand it. Geraldo, if you're going to -- you know, what is your favorite thing? Do you like to grill or do you like to eat?

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: No, I love -- I love grilling personally. And I love steak chard. But corn on the cob really is the favorite. It is corn on the cob, off the grill, you smear it with butter. You go with your beer and what else could happen to make you happier.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Brian Kilmeade?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I can think of a few things.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN KILMEADE, FOX NEWS CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: A couple of things come to mind. Number one, Geraldo, if you eat like that, why do you have the abs that you have? That's impossible. You have either that or a brilliant metabolism which will be the whole -- another hour special for Geraldo and Fox Nation. Number two, what do you think in Jesse? That's bad for the environment having meat, you know that. And I will add this. Dagen, I think you agree with me. We are not allowed to have a cookout until the Fourth of July when we get the green light or red light from the president of United States. So I even think this is bad even to discuss hypothetically. Let's say this is next year and President Biden gave us permission. I would just like a turkey burger. But I would like it to a point where it's unfrozen. That means I have to buy it this year, when I take up the previous year it is so -- it's like a piece of ice from glacier covering a woolly mammoth. And I just can't separate the two. So, I'd like turkey burger, it's frozen, but this year. That's what I like to grow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. I like that too. I'm going to go with potato salad. It's one of the only times --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- you have the potato salad.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: German?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I like the potato salad anyway I can get it. Germans just great. And I'm not -- I really can't make it either so I only have it when I go to somebody else's house. I guess I could make it. I mean, I guess you follow the recipe. But anyway, here's another question from Instagram from Doxie29. Did you ever go to summer camp? And let's start here. Geraldo, did you go to summer camp?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No, my family wasn't a summer camp family.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: He had to dine. I did go to work --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I did go to boy scout camp for -- yes, I was working a lot of the time. But I did go to boy scout camp once for one weekend. And I remember they showed a Dracula, the original Dracula. And I went to bed covering my neck because I was afraid the vampire was going to come suck my blood as I slept in my sleeping bag. So, it was not something that was part of the Rivera family tradition. No summer camps.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Summer camp felt like a little bit of something like more people in the east coast did. I don't know about you, Jesse. Jesse, I believe that you basically lived at summer camp.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, my parents just wanted me out of the house for the whole summer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, who can blame them?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I went to survival school or sometimes it is kind of like reform school, like, I was being sent with other kids into the wilderness who had emotional problems. And I survived. And here I am. But I do want to watch Geraldo's hourlong special on metabolism. That sounds intriguing. And I would definitely pay --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He want me to without the abs now?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I'll wait -- I'll wait for tonight at midnight on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Boy. Well, it could one of those nights if I was there to barbecue having the beer. Brian, did you go to summer camp? And do you send your kids to summer camp?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: No. We don't go to camp. When our big camp you are supposed (Inaudible) the new rules. You have to sit there wrapped up in gauze by yourself with a mask on. I don't think so. On the top bank with strangers, not a great combination. I would add this. I did go to soccer camp. So, it was like you play soccer for 16 hours a day in 110 temperature and you would get water once a day, which didn't make any sense. I thought they were building character, instead ourselves were being starved mitochondria is never the same after a summer camp of just soccer. But I would actually add, too, when it comes to the camp, I just don't think it's a good thing. I mean, what does it say about your family? You go to school all day. You have extracurricular activities. They find --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Camp is the best.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: -- and they say, go away. Go grow up on your own. Check in on your communion confirmation or graduation.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you with me, Dagen? Camp is great.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Camp is for snooty people where I grew up. The only people who went to camp in the mountains are down at the ocean were like, hoity-toity people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I grew up in the woods. Like, who needs to go to camp? We were playing fourth every single day. I did go to girl scout camp, day camp one summer until I got kicked out of the girl scouts because I fuss about them making me go here Jimmy Carter speak when he was the president. And just a quick confession. Geraldo, the thing about sleeping like this because you are afraid of vampires biting your neck, I still do that. I still sleep --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I can't fall sleep unless the covers are up right under my chin from doing that as a kid. So, --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- that's a little weird. Maybe I shouldn't have confessed that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Maybe Dr. Drew should say on speed dial. Geraldo, quick thing with you. The best Dracula -- the best Dracula ever happened in Costello. That was the best Dracula ever. Because it was a comedy yet it was serious you could die. It was the perfect mix and it's in black and white.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know about that.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And you don't watch that?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: When I grew up, only the Jewish kids went to camp. Like Erica, my wife --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. I was not hoity-toity.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They all went to camp.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I went to sky ranch bible camp. That was good.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That's different.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: By a camp.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: It's different.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then I also went summer fun day camp because my mom work as well as my dad, so we did summer fun day camp. I loved that. And every Friday, every other Friday, we got to go to Elitch's which was the amusement park. And if you are wearing your summer fun day camp t-shirt you didn't need tickets for any ride.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. I do have one more thing if I can before we move our camp because I think it's a good story. Jesse ultimately would be the judge. I did summer recreation during the day. So, and the guide that was in charge of my summer wreck was Mr. Baldwin, the father of Alec Baldwin, Billy Baldwin, Stephen Baldwin, and Daniel Baldwin, and he was a big guy, offensive lineman type guy. We've competed in softball against other schools. Great personality. Wonderful leader. Tough guy and a historian. So that was my experience with the Baldwin's first, second, third, and fourth grade. Whatever happened to him? I've lost track.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hold on one second. What is summer recreation? And how is that different than camp, Brian?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Well like I said, I'm amending my original answer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And adding this to it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It's a day camp. They didn't want you to sleep over.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: They want you to go home.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, it's called day camp.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: So, everybody can participate.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's called day camp, Brian.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's day camp and sleep --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I thought we were focusing on like the meatballs with Bill Murray sleeping over filming character.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We got in to Brian today, we need to know. OK. Last question for this block. Facebook Maria M. What does your beach set up look like? Jesse, I know that you have a particular way that you like to set up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm not a shoebie (Ph). I don't bring like loads of gear to the beach. I do prefer the beach lounge chair with the leg extensions. Because I like to go totally horizontal like that and really lay out. That's what I'm all about.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What about you, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know I don't like the beach. I know that's a strange thing for a sailor to say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You don't like the beach?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I sailed around the world. I have -- I always had boats. Yesterday I did -- you know, my friend Mil (Ph) and I did a 300-mile round trip. I love the water. But the beach has always been for kind of sedentary people it seems to me. I never really enjoyed just baking there. I like the water and not the sand.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I have a wicked beach set up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Like down in, like, I got bags already packed in New York City where there isn't any beach. It's got sunscreens and towels. You have to have an umbrella and --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Come on, Coney Island, Rye Beach, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, sort of beaches, Geraldo. Coney Island by the way is like a two-hour subway ride.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It is, it is a long ride.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I can get to Jersey before I can get to the Coney Island but also, crocs are a great beach shoot. That's my tip. And Jesse, you got an infant, you are going to have a wicked beach set up for the summer.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, no kidding. You are going to have a lot more beer than you think.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I can see about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Brian Kilmeade, last word on that beach set up.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I usually put my stuff down and then go for a run and stay on the move. As a kid, I used to go to the beach. And I think Geraldo can relate to this. Actually, Jesse, you, too, from Long Island. There was a beach pass you could take your bike. And that was in high school. You go down with everything you need your essentials to spend the whole day there. Until my bike got stolen at the end of the day and that kind of tore it for me. I just waited it out until I got my license. And so, I don't really have a beach set up and just a bad story at the end.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You seem still upset.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: A little bit.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Kind of lame.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My beach --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I used to have a surfboard that I couldn't use because I didn't know how to surf but it was great for picking up chicks.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. I thought you needed help. My wife (Inaudible) Bay Watch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There's a bunch of waves breaking out there, Geraldo. Why don't you go show us some stuff? No. Ladies, you know, I'm good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I was there since -- I was out there since before dawn.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: All right. More fun mail questions to come on THE FIVE Memorial Day special. Stay right there. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Welcome back, everybody. Happy Memorial Day. We're going to continue to answer your fun mail questions. Brian Kilmeade, happy Memorial Day, also thanks for leaving your barbecue early to come do this show. Let's go to Instagram question from FrenchiFirecracker who always gets those questions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Frenchi?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What would you name your yacht if you had one? Let's go to Geraldo. Do you have a yacht or a sailboat, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: My sailboat voyager. It was called voyager. That was my statement of aspiration, as well as just a name for the vessel. And my current boat I've had for 25 years is called Belle, I named after my oldest daughter, Isabella. And that's a -- I got boarded by the coast guard yesterday. I have some funnier pictures than that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What did you do to get boarded, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I was near the Canadian border and I was doing absolutely nothing. I was boarded by one of those inflatables. Full crew. I got very, you know, testy when they started coming up, why me? And then said well, we have to check these vessels. So 45 minutes later, we left on absolutely good term. That's it. Belle. That's my Hinckley 36-foot Hinckley that I have taken absolutely everywhere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hinckley.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's jet powered boat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not bad.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: We're doing a big benefit here on the boat next week. We are doing a benefit who autism speaks. I'm giving people who pay the most money a ride in Lake Erie, one of the great unused assets here in the Great Lakes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: World's largest body of freshwater.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Keep talking, Geraldo. Let's go. What else? What else happened last weekend?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana, what would you name -- Dana, what would you name your yacht if you had one?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, when he first asked the question, the thing that came to mind was a name that if I said it, it's like a combo -- if I said it, then people might know my passwords. So, I will have to back off of that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I would -- I'm going to go with sea you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sea you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's what I would name. Sea you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sea you? S-e-a?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. S-e-a.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Got it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, sea you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dagen McDowell, what about you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yachts. Plural. Let me correct that. The first one would be named Patsy after Patsy Cline. She was born in Winchester, Virginia. And then my second yacht, my backup in case, like, the first one needs an engine rebuild, would be Merle. It could be a girl's name, but it's really Merle Haggard.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I will probably name my next dogs Patsy and Merle too, just by the way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Cute.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Two yachts. Like a true capitalist. Brian Kilmeade, what would be that name of your yachts?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Well, first off, let's just point out that Geraldo's days off are better than my best days ever. I mean, what kind of life are you leaving?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Just on the Canadian border.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Just having some time going 300 miles on a voyage. I got boarded by the Canadians. You almost had an international incident and that was called Tuesday.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That was U.S. Coast Guard. U.S. Coast Guard.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes, that was Tuesday, right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: OK. So, they spoke our language and not Canadian, so that must've been good for you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The border s closed. The Canadian border is closed.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right. Really?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: By the way --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They closed their own border.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, no kidding. Little by little, they will get to it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's another -- that's another Instagram question.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right. Absolutely. Back to me. Because there's not enough focus on me, I think Dagen agrees. I would just say it would probably be if I could afford the lettering, better than Gutfeld boat. And I would just put that right on the side. And if that could, some could read the whole thing that will be -- if it's big enough. That's all. That's all.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Guys --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And I want people to see that and be great to understand that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very good. I'd probably name mime, I'm Watters and this is might yacht.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: That's nice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's usually what I do with --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: More of a motto.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's go to Instagram question from a Heidi Noyes 1983. We love you, Heidi. Who is your favorite TV family? Let's go with Dagen on this one.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Man. You just stumped me something awful because I am a TV consumer. Do I have to just pick one? The Ricardo's. Lucy and Ricky.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The first family of --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's a great one.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The first family of television. Little Ricky, hilarious show. You can't do any better than that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Geraldo, what about you?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, Desi Arnaz and Lucille Ball were absolutely the favorites in my family. But we also like, you know, the Nelson family, you know, Ricky Nelson, his brother they sang some great tunes during the day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. I have no idea what you guys are talking about, so let's go to Brian.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. First off, I would have been really into the Arnaz's or Lucille Ball. That book came out. Not the best relationship in the world. It kind of ruined it for me. It's out now. You will know what I mean in like a week or two if it actually gets on the bestseller list. But no doubt about it. It's not even close. I'm surprised the others haven't pick this out again. The Cunningham's. I mean, happy days.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Best family by far which is kind of not cool, Chuck disappeared. They never looked for him.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I respect that. You have an older brother disappears who love basketball or chewing gum. He was on the first few episodes, Chuck is gone, no one cares. Richie just assume the top man. Joanie ended up with her spinoff series. The parents had to be very happy about that. He met a great guy with no sleeve, Chachi. Very good. Fonzie was able to fit in live upstairs. That's the family I want to be in. Tom Bosley and Marion got along. I'm kind of mixing real life and other and the big life. But the way they got along despite the height difference is something I think that is something we can all aspire to. It is no doubt the Cunninghams.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. The Cunningham's for the win. What about you, Dana Perino?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would say the Wilders as in Laura Ingalls Wilder in the Little House on the Prairie series. I love that family. I would get from the bus like 3.40 and then that show came on at four o'clock. And I had about three quarters of a mile walk to the front door to get there in time to watch the show because remember there's no DVR's and we can't record. And I would run all the way home in order to get there in time to see my favorite show, Little House on the Prairie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Nice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was going to say --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I thought it was the Geraldo show.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was going to say the Huxtables but we all remember what happened with Bill.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, I'm going to change it. Do you guys remember the wonder years? Kevin Arnold?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The older brother who was a bully and the older sister who was a hippie. And the father who really didn't like to express his true emotions so he just drank and yelled at people. Great show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: How do you not know I love Lucy?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Just like me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, how do you not know I love Lucy?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I was born in 1978.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It repeated forever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. They did not repeat that. No.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Also, I heard it was the first multi-camera shoot where they would set up three cameras and just let these key people act.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I just want to add that. Maybe in retrospect I shouldn't have.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You did go to camp, Brian, the camp of over sharing.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You are right. You're right, Dagen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think Geraldo and Brian would bump together in that camp. Coming up, if we could have an exotic --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Very nice, very nice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- service animal what would it be? We'll answer that next question on THE FIVE's Memorial Day special.

utterances.speaker: MIKE EMANUEL, FOX NEWS CHIEF CONGRESSIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: I'm Mike Emanuel on Washington. Here's a look at today's headlines. President Biden made several political points during his Memorial Day speech from Arlington National Cemetery. The president said democracy is in peril in the U.S. and around the world. He said the soul of America is animated by the perennial battle between our worst instincts and our better angels. Democrats and the Texas legislature have walked out of the House chamber to try to block a controversial election reform bill. But the Republican governor said he will call a special session to try to pass the legislation. An increasing number of American citizens have been apprehended as they have tried to smuggle illegal drugs into the United States since the start of the coronavirus pandemic. Tonight at 6 Eastern, we will have exclusive evidence showing the magnitude of the growing criminal element along the out-of-control southern border. I'm Mike Emanuel in Washington. Please join me for a special report, top of the hour. Now back to THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to THE FIVE Memorial Day special. We're answering more of your fun mail questions. First up, another Instagram question from FrenchiFirecracker. Dana, this one is for you. First up, if you could have an exotic service animal, what would you choose and why? So, an exotic service animal, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, OK, before the commercial break and Jesse said that, I've been thinking about it. And I'm trying to think what the most -- what animal can you most easily clean up after because if it's your service animal, you may still have to clean up after it. So, my first thought was an elephant. And I thought well, wait, that's a lot of cleaning up to do. Hard to do. Then I was thinking of a giraffe because I'm so short it would be fun to be able to like reach things for once. But I think I just go with a sloth. Right? Because I don't know if you need a lot of help.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Big huggers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But everybody would want to come to help you because they want to see you.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I love it. Jesse, what about you? Exotic service animal.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm going to go with a lizard and I'll explain why. You could shove a lizard on your shoulder and you can just go about your day. You don't have to really think about it. So, I'm going to go with lizard, final answer.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, if you're going to do a lizard, why not a monitor lizard, like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know what that is.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, it's one of the largest lizards. I think some of them tend to be they can create horrible infections if they bite you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why would you give me that kind of lizard, Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: well because you could walk it on a leash potentially and scare the doobies out of people on the street. That would be awesome.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'll reconsider.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Brian?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Well, number one, is Dana getting these questions ahead of time? Because that's not -- those aren't the rules.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. Jesse has got it in the tease. That's why they call it a tease.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You listen to me when I speak.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. When I -- when I'm done talking, I just focus on myself. That is the problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we've watched "FOX AND FRIENDS."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. That hurts my feelings, Jesse. How dare you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: At least I watch.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's good because you need to know what to say at FIVE. And for the weekends too, I got to promote both shows that you have.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Oh, but I will bring up this. I believe the spider monkey because the spider monkey to me can function on its own. It's not going to need me. I want a service animal that doesn't need me. Spider monkeys could be there to help, but I think they might be almost the human beings equal. So, I would like a service animal where we help each other rather than just being a one-way street, Spider monkey.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, Geraldo, what about you?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I would take a dolphin when I'm on the water, which is often. So, I'd have the dolphin swimming alongside. And maybe an eagle or a hawk that would roost on my shoulder and, you know, intimidate people go and fetch me a berry or something.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: But what services that? What could -- what could a bird do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They could alert you to the Coast Guard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: At least that. At least that. Hey, it could swim with me, and I'd say, there's a shortage of lifeguards, so the dolphin would be very, very handy if someone fell overboard, for example. And they communicate now, so we get to have a conversation. Hello.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Mine is also a bird because a bird can potentially communicate for you, like a cockatoo maybe or just a parrot. And I've always wanted to be kind of a pirate so I can just have a parrot on my shoulder. I walk around and just greet everybody by saying, hey (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We are learning so much about Dagen McDowell on this show. She wants to be a pirate. She sleeps like this. By the end of the show, we're going to know too much.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That did that is completely 100% true with the covers up around my neck like this. I'm afraid to go to sleep if my neck isn't covered.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Get her a turtle neck and an iPad.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I owned a parrot, actually. I owned a parrot for many years and he used to, you know, mimic -- my parrot mimic my ex-wife. He goes, Geraldo, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Which one?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Which one? How many parrots did you have?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I won't say. I won't say. I have lots of parrots.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's better than the other names they called you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Lots of parrots over the years.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, Geraldo, stay on this. We've got a Facebook question from Bruce B. What was your last dream, Geraldo? And clean answers only or never mind, just whatever your last dream was.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: My last dream. I had a wild and intricate dream that was kind of -- my dreams are like novels that are layered. And I seldom remember them, but they always involve hero, which I always assume is me, and they always have happy endings. I actually love to sleep as a result.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Keep it clean.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That's -- on that note, Jesse, keep it clean. What's your last dream?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I usually don't like to share my dreams, Dagen, because I find it feminine and unbecoming of someone of my stature. But in this case, I will share my last dream. Last night, I dreamed that I was shopping for an Escalade. And I was looking at the dealership and the tires in the front didn't match the tires in the back. And I had to problem-solve it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Only an escalade? Why not something fancier? It's a dream.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fine. What do you want, a Bentley, Dagen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I mean, come on. I'm a simple man.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: On that note, Brian, your last dream.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Well to dream, you have to sleep, and I have not slept since 1997. No, I cannot remember a single dream. I was going -- I was hoping Geraldo and Jesse's story will be longer so I could try to remember one, but I got nothing. I mean, I'm pretty much -- when I hit the pillow, I pass out and then I'm jarred awake at 2:30. So, there's no time to dream and aspire, just time to lose my short-term memory.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: No, that means that you're sleeping very deeply that you can't remember your dreams.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Oh, really?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I just made that up. But I'm trying to make you feel better about that you really have no like, dream life.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Brian has no subconscious. It's all the same.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Thank you, Jesse. I feel so much better now.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Dana, what about your last dream?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, ever since I was a little kid, I love to wake up, unlike Jesse, and tell everybody my dream. Like, I would tell my mom. And then this happened, and then this happened. And now, I realized that is probably a very boring thing to do. The most -- the dream I remember most recently was I dream that -- I won't say who it was but someone pretty senior in the federal government, but at the most senior, resigned. I had this dream. And then the next day, I was going on my business and in my head, I actually thought this person had resigned and I had to fact check it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: My dream last night was actually kind of a sci-fi video game dream where I had a jet ski that could fly, which is pretty cool. But I was still living in my childhood bedroom. So, the dream reminded me that I was still a loser at the end of the day.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Poor, Dagen. You need to see somebody.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Not true. Not true.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I could fly -- I could fly on my jet ski but I was still a huge dork. Up next, do we still do things that we hide from our parents? We'll answer that when our Memorial Day Fan Mail Special returns.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Perfect, perfect song. We were not given permission to go to the beach, but had we gone to the beach, and Joe Biden said it was OK, that would be the music I prefer to hear. And that is the Beach Boys who are timeless. And of course, they're still playing a little bit louder than I thought I would be. I feel like I have to speak over them, which I find a little disconcerting. But I will say this. It takes some time to think about people that have served before the many wars, most of which are World War One Geraldo has covered up close and personal, and I'm not even sure about that one. First off, so, let's continue with our fan mail questions. I'll begin, Jesse, with you. This is Instagram question from Ginny. Evidently, Ginny is hot or hot for Lucas, I am not sure. The question: Do you do anything now that you hide from your parents? Do you do anything now that you have from your parents, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I probably hide my emotions from my parents.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right. There's got to be something. Pretend they're not watching.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't want my parents seeing me upset or angry or off keel. So, I just try to present a nice, calm, everything is OK vibe to my parents, so they don't worry, because parents worry and I don't want them to worry.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: By the way, I'm getting the sense that nothing is right in your life, Jesse. That you're hiding it all. It's a big charade. It's a big facade.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I'm here on Memorial Day. So, you figured it out.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. And I'm a fill-in on Memorial Day. Think about my self-esteem. Hey, Dagen, what about you? Anything you hide from your parents?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Nothing. My parents, my mother -- my mother, in particular, like, when she was diagnosed with cancer, and you know, she passed away about a year and a half ago, like everything was out there. Wow. And it was always like that, for the most part. But literally, we -- every -- I held nothing back. There are a couple of things I told her. She was like, maybe you could have kept that one to yourself. Maybe I didn't need to hear that one. But -- and my dad too. Like we -- there -- we share everything. And it's - - I say that because it's awesome.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's good.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: OK, that's great. You're in a great place. Dana, do you -- are you as healthy as Dagen?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I mean, probably not, no. Absolutely not. I mean, I can't think of anything that I do that's bad that I hide from my parents. But I've got -- also, we don't live close together, so it's like, you know, chit-chat on the phone. I don't tell them anything. Anyway, this feels like therapy to me. Also, I think that by being on THE FIVE for the last nearly 10 years, everyone, including my parents, was everything about me. And there's like, there's nothing left to find out.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Did you drink and not tell them? Did you date and not informed them? There's got to be something.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The question is, do you hide anything now from your parents.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.sentences: OK, you're right. You're right. It was my question. I'm the host. I feel terrible. Geraldo, you could fill in for the rest of the hour.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, my parents are -- my parents have gone to heaven. But you know the old saying that you spend your childhood hiding your weed smoking from your parents, and then as a parent, you spend all your time hiding your weed smoking from your children. I'm just saying that as a -- as a general rule and the like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a great line.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But yes, right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. I feel -- somehow, Geraldo, I feel worse. Here's the Facebook question from Elisa W. And we'll start with you, Dana. Have you ever sent an embarrassing text to the wrong person?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not an embarrassing one, but my husband Peter has a couple -- well, not to the wrong person, but he uses voice text and because he's British, sometimes the translation doesn't pick it up right. And I can't say on the show A couple of the things that have happened, but they are so embarrassing. The next time you see him, you have to have him tell the story. He really needs to read and proofread these things before he hit send because he embarrassed the entire family and the whole (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: OK, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I remember one awful text that I sent that said, I finally broke up with her or I got rid of her something, can we meet next summit, and I send it to the wrong person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's terrible.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Ouch.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: We're not going to use names, right?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Those are many years ago. I don't remember the name.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Dagen.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Yes, well, sort of I thought I did. I was complaining about someone. And I thought I sent that complaint to that person I was complaining about. And I had a mild panic attack.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Wow. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We had to be capable of feeling the emotion of embarrassment so I can't think of anything.

utterances.speaker: KILMEAD
utterances.sentences: All right, guys --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That would be more like you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Tap out. Tap out.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: That's my block. I now put aside my contribution where I took the lead. Now, I'll play color commentator for the rest of the way. Straight ahead on the show, what kind of music do we listen to while driving. Our answers next on THE FIVE Memorial Day Fan Special. Beach Boys come in.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to THE FIVE on this Memorial Day. We have more of your fan mail questions. Jesse, what kind of music do you listen to when you drive around?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, now, listen to Howard because we have satellite radio. But before, you know, Hot 97, 955, PLJ, 1043, Tower 105, you know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Nobody knows what those are.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In New York -- in New York, they know.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But, Dana, what do you like to listen to when you drive?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Country music.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Do you drive?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't drive. I sit and listen. But I am also in charge of the music. So, I like -- if I'm on Sirius XM -- Sirius XM, The Highway is a good one. I like -- well, my husband always has the Bridge on.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Bridge is kind of boring.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I'm telling you, every single time we get in the car, Steely Dan is on every single time.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Worse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, I like to change it to some country music.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Dagen, are you also a county person?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I love country music but when I'm driving and I've gone -- driven a lot in the last few years, I put on songs that I enjoy singing that I know the words to because my voice is so bad that I don't even sing at church. So, it's the only place if I'm alone that I can like belt out Stone Temple Pilots' Interstate Love Song, like great hits from the '90s that I know all the words to that I still remember from say college or post college, so not country. Because country is generally depressing, three chords in the truth. I want something --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. You could listen to songs about beer.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Willy Nelson is great. Johnny -- it's not depressing.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, some of them are. It's about heartbreak, you know, heartbreak.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A lot of heartbreak.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You don't know anything about that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Brian, do you have --

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Brian, is your heart broken?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: No, but I do -- I have to say, if you told me 10 years ago that I like country, I'd say, you're crazy. But now, I listened to the Highway and Trace Atkins on Y2Kountry. I also listen to Howard Stern unless he's complaining about masks and other people not wearing masks. He's taking the pandemic terribly. I find it wearing but he's always endlessly entertaining. I also listen to all sports radio and a lot of podcasts now. Now that I could fully understand how to connect my iPhone to my -- to my radio, I've never had so much control in my life. But I'm hopelessly addicted to talk radio.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That is --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Wait, can I --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A great -- that is a great achievement.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Wait, I got to weigh in here. Brian listens to Florida Georgia Line and he calls it country. NSYNC is more country than Florida Georgia Line.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You are so jealous. You are so jealous because I know them and they think I'm cool. And you Dagen, new country people just don't (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I love Bob Dylan --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I knew Billy Joe Shaver. There's nobody more country than Billy Joe Shaver.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: All right, all right. You guys could debate that later. Dylan, Elvis, Sinatra, Rolling Stones, Grateful Dead, Billie Holiday, that's me driving around. All right, the next question comes from Instagram question from JustMeMary57. Do you have a favorite amusement park ride, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, yes. Gosh, I used to be -- I used to love all of them. And there was this one called -- it was called Stand Up. It was just (INAUDIBLE) and you just stood up, strap yourself in, and they would swing you around and go up and down and about. But I have to say, something has happened as I got older, I as I understand it. Your inner ear balance changes and so you feel like all woozy when you get off a ride. So, I gave it up after I went on this crazy ride at a like a funfair in California in like, 1999. I felt like my brain was rattled all over my head. So, I gave it up but I did love it. Tilt-A-Whirl, I loved all of them.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, you got a bunch of kids. You must love it, love the amusement park rides.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I do. The teacups, Geraldo, are very family-friendly. But if I'm going solo and you know anything with the loop de loop, I'm in. I am in. I scream and cry but I'm in.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Brian?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: President's exhibit at Disney. I like to see the talking mannequins.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That not a ride.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: For me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's an exhibit.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm a -- the Cyclone in Coney Island, the old Cyclone, my favorite ride.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You and Coney Island, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Me too. I love roller coasters.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Coney Island, Coney Island is very underrated. Oh and the big --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You really are living in the '70s.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- the ferry -- the Ferris Wheel at Coney Island is wonderful.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Riding a roller coaster was like --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's tradition. My daughter Sol and I go. All right, that's everybody? OK, we'll be right back with more of your questions or at least one more question up next after this on the special Memorial Day edition of THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. It's time for one more question. OK, Facebook question from Lisa D. What was your biggest splurge last year? I remember, it's COVID year but when you were out shopping or online shopping, what was the biggest splurge? Dagen, you got to have something.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, technically it was adopting my dog Dale because he has called me maybe $10,000 in vet bills so far because he gets into trouble and eat stuff he shouldn't. So, technically that was the biggest splurge.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I remember when you got Dale. Who knew he was going to cost that much money, but worth every penny indeed. Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I bought a house so that was quite expensive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a big splurge. That's a big splurge.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But worth it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, a good investment indeed. Brian Kilmeade.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Home gym and includes -- I just finished it and it includes the fight camp so I could finally take Geraldo with a few more sessions. I'll be able to square off with a man who once owned his own boxing gym.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, OK. Geraldo, how about you?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: World-class boxing. I bought myself a new Bentley in cash, in cash.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: In cash.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, are you running narcotics through the Canadian border? I mean, gosh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I wonder why the Coast Guard is watching us. I bet they are because who wouldn't. I mean, this show is amazing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's why I got to put my cool glasses, guys.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But that is it for us. Enjoying the rest of your Memorial Day, everyone. We will see you back here tomorrow. Content and Programming Copyright 2021 Fox News Network, LLC.
